intro: Contortuplicata contortuplicata, commonly known as the twisted leaf vine, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions. It features heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive wavy margin, and its stems are covered in fine, velvety hairs. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its fruit is a small, round capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. Due to its unique appearance and growth habit, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant.
